t: The Reign of the Lord’s Anointed.
Why*pn are the nations in an uproar And*ln the peoples devising a vain thing?
The*ln kings of the earth take their stand And*ln the rulers take counsel together Against*ln the Lord*s and against His Anointed, saying,
“Let*ln us tear their fetters apart And*ln cast away their cords from us!”
He*ln who sits in the heavens laughs, The*ln Lord scoffs at them.
Then*ln He will speak to them in His anger And*ln terrify them in His fury, saying,
“But*ln as for Me, I have installed My King Upon*ln Zion, My holy mountain.”
“I*ln will surely tell of the decree of the Lord:*s He*ln said to Me, ‘You are My Son, Today*ln I have begotten You.
Ask*ln of Me, and I will surely give the nations as Your inheritance, And*ln the very*i ends of the earth as Your possession.
You*ln shall break them with a rod of iron, You*ln shall shatter them like earthenware.’ ”
Now*ln therefore, O kings, show discernment; Take*ln warning, O judges of the earth.
Worship*ln the Lord*s with reverence And*ln rejoice with trembling.
Do*ln homage to the Son, that He not become angry, and you perish in*i the way, For*ln His wrath may soon be kindled. How*ln blessed are all who take refuge in Him!
